pullRequest.body:
Construct a `ChosenFiniteProducts` instance for the category of affine schemes using the tensor product.

- [x] depends on: #19976

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [4760725a87](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19977/commits/4760725a8702b948f80b70bd4437f5f837dc0e4c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ChosenFiniteProducts` (new file)|1812|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Spec_preservesColimits`
`+ Spec_preservesLimits`
`+ chosen_finite_products_aux`
`+ for`
`+ instance (priority := 100) : ChosenFiniteProducts AffineScheme.{u}`
`+ instance : ChosenFiniteProducts AffineScheme.{0}`
`+ instance : Spec.IsEquivalence := equivCommRingCat.isEquivalence_inverse`
`+ isTerminal`
`+ isoSpec`
`+ on`
`+ specZIsTerminal`
`+ tensorObj`
`+ tensorUnit`
`+ tensorUnit_ULift`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#19976~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I am closing this PR. We do not want to discourage you from contributing to mathlib, but sometimes, there are design choices that we must do. Please do not hesitate discussing some of your mathlib PR projects in the Lean/mathlib Zulip https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4 in case there may be any doubt.
I don't think these are necessary as they are by `inferInstance`.
I think the contents of this file can go in `Algebra/Category/Ring/Constructions`
You're right, will change it in the other PR.

I'm not entirely convinced that this is better than the abstract category-theoretic product. Under this definition `Spec R âŠ— Spec S` is still not defeq to `Spec R âŠ—[â„¤] S` etc.

But I'll wait for the opinions of Adam and others.
Yes, I fully agree. If we want to use the tensor product of rings (or, more interestingly algebras over a base ring), I think we should use `AlgebraCat`.
On the basis of these comments, I propose that we close this PR.

pullRequest.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry): ChosenFiniteProducts for affine schemes.
